| ----------------------------------------------------------------- | ------------------------------------------------------------------------------- |
| Name                                                              | earth                                                                           |
| Appearance                                                        | [random](/wiki/Randomised_appearance "Randomised appearance")                   |
| Base price                                                        | 200 [zm](/wiki/Zorkmid "Zorkmid")                                               |
| Weight                                                            | 5                                                                               |
| Ink to write                                                      | [4–7](/wiki/Magic_marker "Magic marker")                                        |
| Monster use                                                       | *May be used [offensively](/wiki/Offensive_item "Offensive item") by monsters.* |

A **scroll of earth** is a type of [scroll](/wiki/Scroll "Scroll") the appears in *[NetHack](/wiki/NetHack "NetHack")*. It creates [boulders](/wiki/Boulder "Boulder") when read.

[ ]

## Contents

- [1 Generation](#Generation)

- [2 Effects](#Effects)

- [3 Strategy](#Strategy)
  - [3.1 Sokoban](#Sokoban)

- [4 History](#History)

- [5 Messages](#Messages)

- [6 Variants](#Variants)

  - [6.1 UnNetHack](#UnNetHack)
  - [6.2 AceHack](#AceHack)
  - [6.3 SpliceHack](#SpliceHack)

- [7 References](#References)

## Generation

The first level of [Sokoban](/wiki/Sokoban "Sokoban") always has two separate scrolls of earth in a corner past the first set of pits.

Monsters may receive a scroll of earth as a random [offensive item](/wiki/Offensive_item "Offensive item"), but only if they are generated wearing a metal helm; if not, they will receive a [wand of striking](/wiki/Wand_of_striking "Wand of striking") instead.[\[1\]](#cite_note-1)

## Effects

Reading a scroll of earth will [auto-identify](/wiki/Auto-identify "Auto-identify") it and drop boulders around and/or on the reader, depending on its [beatitude](/wiki/Beatitude "Beatitude"):[\[2\]](#cite_note-2) An uncursed scroll of earth will create 9 boulders - 8 around the reader and one on top of their head - while a blessed scroll will create 8 boulders around the reader without dropping one on them, and a cursed scroll will create a single boulder over the reader's head. If there is a wall or [door](/wiki/Door "Door") where a boulder would normally fall, that boulder will not be created. If read while confused, the scroll will drop a few [rocks](/wiki/Rock "Rock") per square instead of boulders, using the same pattern based on the [beatitude](/wiki/Beatitude "Beatitude") of the scroll.[\[3\]](#cite_note-3)

Reading a scroll of earth on a Sokoban level before solving that floor will decrease your [Luck](/wiki/Luck "Luck") by 1;[\[4\]](#cite_note-4)[\[5\]](#cite_note-5) reading the scroll on the [Rogue level](/wiki/Rogue_level "Rogue level") and the [Elemental Planes](/wiki/Elemental_Planes "Elemental Planes") has no effect, except for the [Plane of Earth](/wiki/Plane_of_Earth "Plane of Earth").[\[6\]](#cite_note-6)

A boulder that falls on a monster does 1d20 points of damage and can wake up nearby monsters with the [noise](/wiki/Noise "Noise")[\[7\]](#cite_note-7) - if they are wearing a hard helmet, it bounces off and deals just 2 points of damage. A scroll of earth does no damage to [amorphous](/wiki/Amorphous "Amorphous"), [phasing](/wiki/Phasing "Phasing"), noncorporeal, or [unsolid](/wiki/Unsolid "Unsolid") monsters.[\[8\]](#cite_note-8) Intelligent monsters can read this scroll for offensive purposes, but will only read them 10% of the time *unless* they would be unaffected by the boulders, or else are wearing a hard helmet. Monsters will not read the scroll in areas where the scroll has no effect.[\[9\]](#cite_note-9)

## Strategy

The scroll of earth is most commonly used to create "[boulder forts](/wiki/Boulder_fort "Boulder fort")" as a relatively safe way to deal with a dangerous monster or horde of monsters - many monsters will not be able to attack a player they cannot see, and the boulders prevent most monsters from approaching even if they are aware of your position. While within this "fort", the player can use [telepathy](/wiki/Telepathy "Telepathy") to detect them and attack with missile weapons and spells. Be careful of [force bolts](/wiki/Spellbook_of_force_bolt "Spellbook of force bolt") and [striking](/wiki/Wand_of_striking "Wand of striking") wands, as they will destroy boulders.

Alternately, you can use the boulders to create your own choke point, e.g. by carefully moving a single boulder to allow only one monster through. This is best done on a staircase, a [scroll of scare monster](/wiki/Scroll_of_scare_monster "Scroll of scare monster") and/or a burnt [Elbereth](/wiki/Elbereth "Elbereth") square to allow a means of escape if things go poorly. You can also use the boulders to block off up [stairs](/wiki/Stair "Stair") or [ladders](/wiki/Ladder "Ladder") to prevent [demon lords](/wiki/Demon_lord "Demon lord") and other [covetous](/wiki/Covetous "Covetous") monsters from warping and fleeing to another floor. Boulders from the scroll can also be used to trap [aligned priests](/wiki/Aligned_priest "Aligned priest") in order to convert a [temple](/wiki/Temple "Temple") [altar](/wiki/Altar "Altar") - see their page for details.

Scrolls of earth can be used to fill [trapdoors](/wiki/Trapdoor "Trapdoor"), [holes](/wiki/Hole "Hole"), and [moats](/wiki/Moat "Moat") - if you lack a source of [levitation](/wiki/Levitation "Levitation"), this can be another way to cross large bodies of water, such as [Medusa's Island](/wiki/Medusa%27s_Island "Medusa's Island") or the moat at the [Castle](/wiki/Castle "Castle"). While you can use them to fill the Castle trap doors, keep in mind that filling all of them means you must dig one out again to reach Gehennom.

### Sokoban

The scrolls of earth found in Sokoban are intended as backups in case boulders are destroyed or additional pits/holes need to be filled, and can be used to informally identify any other scrolls you may have picked up previously. Remember that reading any scroll of earth on an unsolved level will incur a Luck penalty, and try to identify their [beatitude](/wiki/Beatitude "Beatitude") beforehand if possible - for example, a blessed scroll will leave more boulders free to move, and there are situations where a single boulder from a cursed scroll is preferable. You may also want to position yourself before reading depending on how many boulders are actually needed.

Breaking boulders on unsolved levels also incurs a Luck penalty - as such, try not to let any intelligent monsters (e.g., [nymphs](/wiki/Nymph "Nymph")) steal and use scrolls of earth in Sokoban, or you may be forced to repair your Luck *and* their mess. Thankfully, most monsters will hesitate to read the scroll unless they have a hard helm, hopefully providing time to kill them fast enough.

## History

The scroll of earth first appears in [NetHack 3.3.0](/wiki/NetHack_3.3.0 "NetHack 3.3.0").

## Messages

- The ceiling rumbles \<around/above> you!

  You read a scroll of earth in the main dungeon and produced boulders, with "around" used if the scroll is blessed and "above" used otherwise.

## Variants

Many variants add new Sokoban levels, including possible first level maps that include one or two scrolls of earth.

### UnNetHack

In [UnNetHack](/wiki/UnNetHack "UnNetHack"), scrolls of earth have no effect 50% of the time in the [black market](/wiki/Black_market_\(UnNetHack\) "Black market (UnNetHack)").

### AceHack

In [AceHack](/wiki/AceHack "AceHack"), scrolls of earth are identified for you as soon as you reach the guaranteed scrolls in Sokoban.

### SpliceHack

In [SpliceHack](/wiki/SpliceHack "SpliceHack") and [SpliceHack-Rewrite](/wiki/SpliceHack-Rewrite "SpliceHack-Rewrite"), you can combine a scroll of earth with a [leather drum](/wiki/Leather_drum "Leather drum") at a furnace to make a [drum of earthquake](/wiki/Drum_of_earthquake "Drum of earthquake").

[Dal Zethire](/wiki/Dal_Zethire "Dal Zethire"), the [Cartomancer](/wiki/Cartomancer "Cartomancer") [quest nemesis](/wiki/Quest_nemesis "Quest nemesis"), generates with a scroll of earth.
